body_html:
To understand name_scope and why it's useful, I suggest reading the "Name scoping and nodes" section on this page:
https://www.tensorflow.org/get_started/graph_viz#name_scoping_and_nodes

To understand variable_scope and why it's useful, I suggest reading the "Sharing Variables" section on this page:
https://www.tensorflow.org/programmers_guide/variables#sharing_variables

I stumbled upon this issue after some Googling because:

  • I was reading the beginner tutorial, Deep MNIST for Experts, and in the beginning it said "...you can download the fully implemented deep net from mnist_deep.py"
  • mnist_deep.py had lots of tf.name_scope() calls, but there was no mention of name_scope on the tutorial itself.

I believe some beginners going through the same tutorial will find this a bit confusing.
body_text:
To understand name_scope and why it's useful, I suggest reading the "Name scoping and nodes" section on this page:
https://www.tensorflow.org/get_started/graph_viz#name_scoping_and_nodes
To understand variable_scope and why it's useful, I suggest reading the "Sharing Variables" section on this page:
https://www.tensorflow.org/programmers_guide/variables#sharing_variables
I stumbled upon this issue after some Googling because:

I was reading the beginner tutorial, Deep MNIST for Experts, and in the beginning it said "...you can download the fully implemented deep net from mnist_deep.py"
mnist_deep.py had lots of tf.name_scope() calls, but there was no mention of name_scope on the tutorial itself.

I believe some beginners going through the same tutorial will find this a bit confusing.
body:
To understand `name_scope` and why it's useful, I suggest reading the "Name scoping and nodes" section on this page:
https://www.tensorflow.org/get_started/graph_viz#name_scoping_and_nodes

To understand `variable_scope` and why it's useful, I suggest reading the "Sharing Variables" section on this page:
https://www.tensorflow.org/programmers_guide/variables#sharing_variables

I stumbled upon this issue after some Googling because:

- I was reading the beginner tutorial, [Deep MNIST for Experts](https://www.tensorflow.org/get_started/mnist/pros), and in the beginning it said "...you can download the fully implemented deep net from [mnist_deep.py](https://www.github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.3/tensorflow/examples/tutorials/mnist/mnist_deep.py)"
- [mnist_deep.py](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.3/tensorflow/examples/tutorials/mnist/mnist_deep.py) had lots of `tf.name_scope()` calls, but there was no mention of `name_scope` on the [tutorial itself](https://www.tensorflow.org/get_started/mnist/pros).

I believe some beginners going through the same tutorial will find this a bit confusing.
